feed.title: Category: rubymine | Drew Sheneman - Software Developer

entry.title: Git Tools in RubyMine
entry.content:
While I will probably always prefer the command line for git commands over any GUI interface, here is a solid introduction to using the tools that RubyMine provides to make version control more convenient:

pivotallabs.com/everyday-git-commands-in-rubymine/

entry.title: Debugging in Ruby 2.0
entry.content:
When trying to debug Rails applications that have been updated to use Ruby 2.0, you may run across some errors either via ‘bundle update’ or when trying to migrate the database. To resolve these and enable debugging, replace the ruby-debug-base19x gem with ‘debase’.

group :development, :test do
  gem 'debase'
  gem 'ruby-debug-ide', '0.4.17'
end
